private_information: I know the actions paltry, sip and clip and their formal preconditions and effects as given by the user.

paltry preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2. paltry effects add: next object_0 object_2. paltry effects remove: vase object_0 object_1.
sip preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2. sip effects add: vase object_0 object_1. sip effects remove: next object_0 object_2.

clip preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2. clip effects add: vase object_0 object_1. clip effects remove: next object_0 object_2.
I was provided with the first STATEMENT initial facts and a proposed plan fragment that uses clip, sip, paltry and related actions.
analyst_A.goal: Analyze the first statement, verify consistency of action preconditions and effects with the provided plan fragment, and produce a structured summary of reachable facts and needed dependencies.

private_information: I know the actions wretched, memory and tightfisted and their formal preconditions and effects as given by the user.

wretched preconditions: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3. wretched effects add: next object_0 object_2. wretched effects remove: next object_0 object_1.
memory preconditions: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1. memory effects add: next object_0 object_2. memory effects remove: next object_0 object_1.

tightfisted preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1. tightfisted effects add: next object_0 object_2. tightfisted effects remove: vase object_0 object_1.
I was provided with the second STATEMENT initial facts and a proposed plan fragment that uses wretched, memory and tightfisted and related actions.
analyst_B.goal: Analyze the second statement, validate action applicability in the proposed plan fragment, and produce a structured summary of reachable facts and needed dependencies.

private_information: I coordinate analysts and produce the final integrated PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver.
I must keep agent actions distinct when encoding multi-agent or multi-fragment behaviors into a single PDDL model or clearly namespaced action set.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate analyses from analyst_A and analyst_B, reconcile naming and object usages, and emit a PDDL domain and problem that captures the actions, initial facts and goals for use with the FastDownwards planner.

public_information: Available actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Objects referenced in the scenarios include object_0 through object_13 in various facts and plan steps.

Two separate statement blocks were provided. The first includes an initial fact set and a goal aiming to achieve next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_12 object_8 and next object_9 object_5. The second includes a different initial fact set and a goal aiming to achieve next object_10 object_6, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_7 and next object_13 object_9.

Agents analyst_A and analyst_B each received one of the statement blocks and an associated plan fragment. The orchestrator must integrate their analyses to build a single PDDL description appropriate for FastDownwards.

analyze.system_prompt: You are Agent analyst_A. Your role is to inspect the provided action schemas paltry, sip and clip together with the first statement initial facts and the associated plan fragment. Produce a concise structured report that lists for each action its preconditions and effects, identifies which plan steps are applicable given the initial facts or are dependent on earlier actions, and list any ambiguous object references or naming conflicts that would matter when integrating with other analyses. Do not emit PDDL. Provide the output as a clearly structured textual summary suitable for programmatic integration.
analyze.prompt: You are analyst_A. Use your private information and the environment public information to analyze the first statement and the associated plan fragment. Produce a structured summary of action applicability, dependencies between plan steps, and any unresolved references or assumptions that must be communicated to the orchestrator. Output the summary as a single-line json-friendly text block.

analyze.system_prompt: You are Agent analyst_B. Your role is to inspect the provided action schemas wretched, memory and tightfisted together with the second statement initial facts and the associated plan fragment. Produce a concise structured report that lists for each action its preconditions and effects, identifies which plan steps are applicable given the initial facts or are dependent on earlier actions, and list any ambiguous object references or naming conflicts that would matter when integrating with other analyses. Do not emit PDDL. Provide the output as a clearly structured textual summary suitable for programmatic integration.
analyze.prompt: You are analyst_B. Use your private information and the environment public information to analyze the second statement and the associated plan fragment. Produce a structured summary of action applicability, dependencies between plan steps, and any unresolved references or assumptions that must be communicated to the orchestrator. Output the summary as a single-line json-friendly text block.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your task is to integrate the structured analyses from analyst_A and analyst_B, resolve naming mismatches and ambiguities, and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the actions, initial facts and final goals. The resulting PDDL must be compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Keep agent-related actions distinct by namespacing or action prefixes if needed. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The domain and problem should be self-contained and fully specified for FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Use the environment public information and the two analysis outputs provided to produce a coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem for FastDownwards that captures the available actions, initial facts from both statement blocks, and both goal sets. Reconcile object names and ensure action preconditions and effects are consistent across agents. Keep agent actions distinct if you need to represent multi-fragment or concurrent behavior. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
